column5: Hi Thought I would share my quinte trip.  It started by visiting the local tackle shop and speaking with the owner.  Very nice fella who recommended using worm harnesses with huge Colorado blades (1 1/2 - 2 inch wide).  I was a little apprehensive as my go to lure is the earie dearie, anyway we bought 2 of them and some worms.  Sure glad we took his advice as 10 of the 12 walleye we landed came on these harnesses.  Any way we managed our limit and more.  Good times for sure and an awesome feed! Thanks for reading.
Now that's a good lookin dinner, and a nice stringer of pics!
Love Quinte eyes!!! One of your friends a chef??? Really nice looking presentation!!!
Great Quinte haul for ya, congrats dude.
Thanks guys. I have been known to cook a little. lol.
Nice haul for sure!!! Yummy!  The Big girls are getting ready to hit the Bay again!!!!!!!!!! Can't wait to see all those marks fill up my screens soon! Bring on the 10+'s!
Thanks for sharing your Quinte story, especially about the big blades.  David  aka  Superdad  PS  Only a month and a bit til November!!!!!
Nice Catch. Very creative looking plate.
I never seem to meet up with those big girls! Kind of gave up after a few years of trying.  That is a nice stringer for this time of year, great job!
Jimmer, don't give up on them cause when you figure them out, it's INSANE! Maybe you can join me on an outing this year.... trolling in the fall or on the ice, either works for me.
Great catch guys !!!!! Good ole worm harnesses strike again !!!! I use a number 5 Indiana blade on my harnesses there as well !!!!!! Cheers
I might just take you up on that! Thanks. We'll see how the fall goes. The ice sounds great too.
